results.title: Puberty
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Part 3 of a three part series which follows through the educational experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. In this part the children and their teachers learn about puberty, focusing on menstruation and “wet dreams”.

results.title: BYO: scare
results.creator_credit: Eric Mival and Queensland.Dept. of Education. Production Services Branch
results.brief_description: One in a series of films following BYO, this episode raises the question of impaired judgement in driving after drinking. A discussion starter for teenagers. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Official information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
A journalist comes across a confidential government paper concerning major, but controversial, tradedeal for Britain. The government asks for its publication to be delayed. What does the newspaper do? Moderated by Paul Sieghart.

results.title: Breaking point
results.creator_credit: Brian McDuffie, Justin Milne, Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at mental breakdown and the treatment of mental disorders by presenting a dramatisation of 2 case studies : a young girl suffering from schizophrenia and a middle aged man who is depressive. Cast includes Marcia Deane-Johns, Leo Taylor, Barbara West, Wayne Bell, Shane Withington.

results.title: Doctors' orders
results.creator_credit: Colin Richards and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
After the publication of a report on prescribing in general practice, the program looks at the reasons for over-prescribing and talks to several general practitioners who feel they are being pressurised by both patients and drug companies into this expensive and potentially dangerous situation.

results.title: Cecily
results.brief_description: An animated film about a little girl who, discovering she can fly by flapping her ears, takes off for Africa. She makes friends with the elephants, who have ears as big as hers, and forms an elephant orchestra which becomes world famous. Based on the story by Milos Macourek.

results.title: Primary sources: the raw material of history
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to History”.
The film uses London as a place to show how different primary sources can be used to study its history. The primary sources include an excavated Roman bath-house, early documents, pottery, maps, paintings, business records and archival film.
